faq.q1: What does it mean that the development is a cooperative?
faq.a1:
• Member participation: vote on finishes and milestones.
  • 15–20% savings compared to a traditional developer.
  • Tax advantages: exemption from ITP/AJD on land purchase.
  • Professional management (administrative, commercial, technical and financial).
  • Member contributions held in a notarial escrow account.
  • Guarantee/insurance after license as per LOE.
faq.a2:
• Typical reservation: €3,000–€5,000 (depending on project).
  • Notarial escrow with a deed regulating fund disbursement.
  • Before license: LOE does not require a guarantee; a notarial account is used.
faq.a3:
• Cooperative incorporation and organization.
  • Application and obtaining of building license.
  • Start of construction after license and financial close.
  • Execution estimate: 12–24 months.
  • Allocation deed and handover of keys.
faq.a4:
• VAT 10% on each payment for the home.
  • Notary and registry ~0.5–1%.
  • Stamp Duty (AJD) 1.2% in Andalusia.
  • Community fees from handover.
faq.a5:
• Valid ID/passport.
  • NIE required.
  • Power of attorney only if you won’t attend the signing; Apostille and sworn translation if granted abroad.
